DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Agent Dose Modification Dose Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of protocol therapy agent administration dose modifications.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Agent Dose Modification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents. (ICH)_An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents. (ICH):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A document that describes the objective(s), design, methodology, statistical considerations, and organization of a trial. The protocol usually also gives the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be provided in other protocol referenced documents. Throughout the ICH GCP Guideline the term protocol refers to protocol and protocol amendments. NOTE: Present usage can refer to any of three distinct entities: 1) the plan (i.e., content) of a protocol, 2) the protocol document, and 3) a series of tests or treatments (as in oncology). [ICH E6 Glossary]
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
